title: Michigan School Shooting Suspect’s Parents Charged With Involuntary Manslaughter
sub_head: Teen’s father bought gun days before it was used to kill four and injure seven, officials say
body:
A county prosecutor in Michigan on Friday charged the parents of Ethan Crumbley, a high-school sophomore accused of killing four classmates this week with a semiautomatic handgun, with four counts of involuntary manslaughter.
Oakland County prosecutors said James and Jennifer Crumbley were charged in connection with the gun used in the shooting. The father allegedly bought the gun, with the teenager present at the purchase, days before the shooting, officials said.
